basics.details: Most crops prefer fertile, well-drained soil with added organic matter. Add compost or well-rotted manure before planting.
Choose pots at least 25–30 cm deep for root crops and 40L+ bags for potatoes. Ensure drainage holes at the base.
Ideal for small gardens or wet soils. Fill with a mix of topsoil, compost, and organic matter. Helps improve drainage and warms faster in spring.
Ensure soil is free of large stones and weeds. Rake to a fine tilth before sowing seeds directly.
Most small seeds (lettuce, carrots, spinach) 0.5–1.5 cm deep. Larger seeds (peas, beans, sweetcorn) 3–5 cm deep. Potatoes: 10–15 cm deep.
Leafy crops 20–30 cm apart. Root crops 5–10 cm apart in rows 15–20 cm apart. Legumes 20–25 cm apart. Fruiting crops 40–60 cm apart.
Use fleece or cloches to protect early sowings. Net brassicas against pigeons and butterflies. Mesh against carrot fly. Cold frames extend season.
Most crops prefer full sun (6+ hours). Leafy crops and herbs like mint tolerate part shade. Avoid deep shade.
Keep soil evenly moist, especially in pots. Avoid waterlogging. Mulch helps retain moisture.
Leafy crops: nitrogen-rich feed. Fruiting crops: high-potash feed once flowers form. Root crops: balanced fertiliser at planting.
Cold frames, cloches, and polytunnels extend the growing season. Greenhouses protect tender crops like tomatoes, cucumbers, and peppers.
